title: Japan v Scotland match on
text:
Stand easy Scotland. Start getting revved up Japan. The match is happening, the contest is live, the possibilities are open-ended.

Japan can progress through to the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals for the first time in their history or Scotland can cause heartbreak across a newly-enthused rugby-daft country by trumping them at the last. It’s game on. For that, we can all breathe a sigh of relief.

If nothing else, though, the disturbing images of flooded rivers and widespread damage caused by Typhoon Hagibis especially in the northern city of Kamaishi, which suffered so much grief as a result of the 2011 tsunami, causing Sunday’s match between Namibia and Canada to be cancelled, ought to put in...
